description: Agra, located in northern India, is globally renowned as the home of the Taj Mahal, one of the New Seven Wonders of the World. Founded in the early 16th century, Agra served as the capital of the Mughal Empire under Emperor Akbar and remains a significant historical and cultural city. Besides the Taj Mahal, Agra boasts several other Mughal-era architectural marvels, including the Agra Fort and the tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah. The city’s rich history and architectural heritage make it a major tourist destination, attracting visitors from all over the world.

tourist_places.name: Taj Mahal
tourist_places.description: The Taj Mahal is an exquisite white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Completed in 1653, it is celebrated for its stunning beauty and intricate craftsmanship. The Taj Mahal's symmetrical gardens, reflecting pools, and the central dome are architectural masterpieces that draw millions of visitors each year.

tourist_places.name: Agra Fort
tourist_places.description: Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is a massive red sandstone fortification that served as the main residence of Mughal emperors until the capital was moved to Delhi. The fort features impressive structures such as the Jahangir Palace, Khas Mahal, and the Diwan-i-Am (Hall of Public Audience). Its location along the Yamuna River offers excellent views of the Taj Mahal.

tourist_places.name: Itimad-ud-Daulah (Baby Taj)
tourist_places.description: Itimad-ud-Daulah, often referred to as the Baby Taj, is a mausoleum built for Mirza Ghiyas Beg, a Mughal minister. Completed in 1628, it is renowned for its intricate marble inlay work and detailed carvings. The monument is considered a precursor to the Taj Mahal and showcases similar architectural elements and craftsmanship.

tourist_places.name: Mehtab Bagh
tourist_places.description: Mehtab Bagh is a charming garden located on the opposite side of the Yamuna River from the Taj Mahal. It offers a picturesque view of the monument and is an ideal spot for photography, especially during sunrise and sunset. The garden’s layout and design are reminiscent of Mughal-era landscaping and provide a tranquil setting away from the crowds.

tourist_places.name: Jama Masjid
tourist_places.description: Jama Masjid, located in the heart of Agra, is one of the largest mosques in India. Built by Emperor Shah Jahan, it features an expansive courtyard, ornate domes, and intricately carved marble details. The mosque’s architecture reflects the grandeur of Mughal design and offers a serene space for reflection and prayer.

tourist_places.name: Sikandra
tourist_places.description: Sikandra is the tomb of Emperor Akbar, located on the outskirts of Agra. The tomb is set within a beautiful garden and showcases a blend of Hindu, Persian, and Mughal architectural styles. The structure is noted for its impressive design, including its four minarets and elaborate decoration, reflecting Akbar’s vision of religious tolerance and harmony.

hotels.name: The Oberoi Amarvilas
hotels.description: The Oberoi Amarvilas is a luxury hotel offering stunning views of the Taj Mahal from its rooms and suites. Located just a short distance from the monument, the hotel features lavish accommodations, a full-service spa, and exquisite dining options. Its blend of opulent design and modern amenities provides an exceptional stay for visitors to Agra.

hotels.name: ITC Mughal
hotels.description: ITC Mughal is a luxury hotel set amidst 35 acres of lush gardens. The hotel’s architecture and design are inspired by Mughal aesthetics, offering spacious rooms, a large swimming pool, and a range of dining options. Its proximity to major attractions and its tranquil environment make it a preferred choice for travelers.

restaurants.name: Peshawri
restaurants.description: Peshawri is an acclaimed restaurant located in the ITC Mughal Hotel, known for its authentic North-West Frontier cuisine. The restaurant features traditional dishes such as kebabs, tandoori specialties, and rich curries, all prepared using traditional methods. The rustic decor and warm ambiance enhance the dining experience.

restaurants.name: Pinch of Spice
restaurants.description: Pinch of Spice is a popular restaurant offering a diverse menu of Indian and international cuisine. Located near the Taj Mahal, it is known for its flavorful dishes, including biryanis, kebabs, and curries. The restaurant’s casual setting and variety of options make it a favorite among tourists and locals alike.

activities: Visit the Taj Mahal to marvel at its breathtaking beauty and architectural brilliance.
Explore the Agra Fort to discover the historical significance and grandeur of Mughal architecture.
Wander through Mehtab Bagh for picturesque views of the Taj Mahal and a peaceful garden experience.
Experience the intricate designs of Itimad-ud-Daulah, also known as the Baby Taj.
Tour the tomb of Akbar at Sikandra and admire its unique architectural blend and serene surroundings.
tips_and_tricks: Dress modestly when visiting religious sites and monuments.
Carry a hat, sunglasses, and sunscreen to protect yourself from the sun.
Use bottled water and avoid street food to prevent stomach issues.
Book tickets for major attractions in advance to avoid long queues and ensure entry.
